greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest prime p such that the greatest prime factor of p^2-1 is prime(n).
comment: The terms were computed using Filip Najman's list, see the link.
link: Filip Najman, Home Page (gives all numbers n such that n^2-1 has no prime factor greater than 97)
program: /* S[] is the list computed by Filip Najman (16223 elements) */
xref: Cf. A175607 (largest number k such that the greatest prime factor of k^2-1 is prime(n)).
results.author: _Joerg Arndt_, Jul 03 2012
